result.execSummary:
The defendant Kree A. Simonsmeier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: consecutive to 14CF429 and any previously ordered sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, restitution & surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.
No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.  Undertake AODA assessment and  comply with treatment recommendations.  Pay supervisory fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Defendant shall maintain full time employment.  Should defendant become unemployed he shall apply at 30 businesses/month that are hiring and file work search affidavits.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
